children.text: There are several walls throughout that have been constructed out of plumb.
he Victorian Building Authority’s, Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 4.02 Verticality or Plumbness of Steel and Timber Frames and Exposed Posts, states
‘Posts and wall frames are defective if they deviate from vertical by more than 5mm within any 1.8 metre height’.
These walls, and the walls that run into them will need to be re-plumbed into their correct position prior to the installation of the plaster.
